translations.chinese: 足下 前則失咸陽之約，後有彊宛之患。
translations.english: Ahead you lose the agreement about Xianyang, behind you have the danger of strong Wan.

translations.chinese: 為足下計，莫若約降，封其守，因使止守，引其甲卒與之西。
translations.english: For your sake, it would be better to make a treaty for surrender, enfeoff the governor, and then order him to remain as governor, leading his armored troops west with you.

translations.chinese: 諸城未下者，聞聲爭開門而待足下，足下通行無所累。」
translations.english: The cities that have not yet surrendered will hear of this and compete to open their gates waiting for you. You will pass through without hindrance."

translations.chinese: 七月，南陽守齮降，封為殷侯，封陳恢千戶。
translations.english: In the seventh month, Nanyang governor Yin surrendered. He was enfeoffed as Lord Yin, and Chen Hei was enfeoffed with a thousand households.
